exam.title: YDS Tam Deneme Sınavı 5
exam.description: 80 soruluk tam boy YDS deneme sınavı - Gerçek sınav formatında hazırlanmıştır

questions.question_text: By the time the rescue team arrived, the hikers ---- in the mountains for over twelve hours.
questions.explanation: 'By the time' ifadesi past perfect tense kullanımını gerektirir. Kurtarma ekibi gelmeden önce başlayan ve belirli bir süre devam eden durum için 'had been stranded' kullanılır.

questions.question_text: The pharmaceutical company conducted extensive trials to ---- the safety and efficacy of the new drug.
questions.explanation: 'Verify' (doğrulamak) bilimsel araştırma bağlamında güvenlik ve etkililik için kullanılan doğru terimdir. Diğer seçenekler olumsuz veya uygunsuz anlamlar taşır.

questions.question_text: ---- advances in medical technology, many diseases that were once fatal are now treatable.
questions.explanation: 'Thanks to' (sayesinde) olumlu bir sonuç ve neden-sonuç ilişkisini gösterir. Tıbbi teknolojideki ilerlemeler sayesinde hastalıklar tedavi edilebiliyor.

questions.question_text: The archaeological findings have ---- challenged the previously accepted theories about ancient civilizations.
questions.explanation: 'Fundamentally' (temelden, esaslı bir şekilde) arkeolojik bulguların teorileri ciddi şekilde sorguladığını ifade eder. Bu akademik bağlamda en uygun zarftır.

questions.question_text: The board of directors insisted that the CEO ---- a detailed report on the company's financial situation.
questions.explanation: 'Insist', 'demand', 'require' gibi fiillerden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. Bu nedenle 'prepare' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: Climate scientists warn that without immediate action, the consequences of global warming will be ----.
questions.explanation: 'Irreversible' (geri dönüşü olmayan) uyarı bağlamında ve 'without immediate action' ifadesiyle uyumludur. Küresel ısınmanın sonuçları geri döndürülemez olacak.

questions.question_text: ---- the increasing demand for renewable energy, many countries are investing heavily in solar and wind power.
questions.explanation: 'In response to' (yanıt olarak) talep artışına karşılık yapılan yatırımları ifade eder. Bu neden-sonuç ilişkisini en doğru yansıtan ifadedir.

questions.question_text: The new legislation aims to ---- workers' rights and improve workplace conditions.
questions.explanation: 'Safeguard' (korumak, güvence altına almak) haklar bağlamında kullanılan doğru terimdir. Yeni yasanın amacı işçi haklarını korumaktır.

questions.question_text: Not only ---- the project on time, but they also managed to stay within the budget.
questions.explanation: 'Not only' cümle başında kullanıldığında inversion (devrik soru yapısı) gerektirir: not only + auxiliary + subject + main verb. Bu nedenle 'did they complete' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: The economist's prediction proved to be remarkably ----, as the market behaved exactly as forecasted.
questions.explanation: 'Accurate' (isabetli, doğru) tahmin ile kollokasyon oluşturur ve cümlenin ikinci kısmındaki 'exactly as forecasted' ile uyumludur.

questions.question_text: The museum director suggested that all visitors ---- their belongings in the lockers provided.
questions.explanation: 'Suggest' fiilinden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. Bu nedenle 'store' doğru cevaptır.

questions.question_text: The research findings ---- the hypothesis that early language exposure enhances cognitive development.
questions.explanation: 'Support' (desteklemek) hipotez ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur ve araştırma bulgularının pozitif yönünü ifade eder.

questions.question_text: ---- had the announcement been made than hundreds of applicants submitted their resumes.
questions.explanation: 'No sooner...than' yapısı kullanılır (hardly/scarcely...when kullanılır). Bu yapı iki eylemin hemen peş peşe gerçekleştiğini ifade eder ve inversion gerektirir.

questions.question_text: The government's failure to address the housing crisis has ---- public frustration and protests.
questions.explanation: 'Fuel' (körüklemek, alevlendirmek) hükümetin başarısızlığının halk huzursuzluğunu artırdığını ifade eder. Metaforik kullanımda doğru seçenektir.

questions.question_text: The committee will not approve the proposal unless it ---- revised to address all the concerns raised.
questions.explanation: 'Unless' (eğer...mezse) zaman cümleciklerinde 'will' kullanılmaz, present tense kullanılır. Future meaning için present simple veya present perfect kullanılır.

questions.question_text: The company's innovative marketing strategy has ---- its position as a market leader in the technology sector.
questions.explanation: 'Consolidate' (pekiştirmek, sağlamlaştırmak) pozisyon ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur ve şirketin lider konumunu güçlendirdiğini ifade eder.

questions.question_text: ---- to popular belief, the majority of shark species pose little threat to humans.
questions.explanation: 'Contrary to' (aksine) yaygın inanışın tersini söylerken kullanılır. Bu ifade bir zıtlık belirtir.

questions.question_text: The historian's account of the events was praised for its ---- and attention to detail.
questions.explanation: 'Objectivity' (nesnellik, tarafsızlık) övgü bağlamında ve 'attention to detail' ile birlikte kullanılan uygun terimdir. Tarihçi tarafsız bir anlatım yapmıştır.

questions.question_text: The project team ---- considerable progress if they had received adequate funding from the beginning.
questions.explanation: Third conditional (Type 3): If + past perfect, would have + past participle. Geçmişte gerçekleşmemiş bir durumu ve olası sonucunu ifade eder.

questions.question_text: The medical breakthrough has the potential to ---- the treatment of chronic diseases.
questions.explanation: 'Revolutionize' (devrim yaratmak) tıbbi atılım bağlamında tedavide köklü değişiklik yapma potansiyelini ifade eder.

questions.question_text: Artificial intelligence systems are becoming increasingly sophisticated, ----.
questions.option_a: although they still lack the creativity and intuition that humans possess
questions.option_b: because their processing speeds are limited by current hardware
questions.option_c: provided that they receive minimal training data
questions.option_d: so that they can replace human workers entirely
questions.option_e: unless programmers stop developing new algorithms
questions.explanation: AI sistemleri gelişiyor ancak insan yaratıcılığı ve sezgisine sahip değil. 'Although' ile başlayan seçenek bu zıtlığı en iyi ifade eder.

questions.question_text: ---- that regular exercise not only improves physical health but also enhances mental well-being.
questions.explanation: Düzenli egzersizin hem fiziksel hem zihinsel sağlığa faydası bilimsel olarak kanıtlanmıştır. 'Research has consistently shown' bu olumlu bulguyu destekler.

questions.question_text: The company invested millions in developing the new product, ----.
questions.option_a: only to see it fail in the market due to poor consumer reception
questions.option_b: so it became the most profitable venture in the industry
questions.option_c: because competitors had already abandoned similar projects
questions.option_d: unless market research indicated guaranteed success
questions.option_e: although it required minimal financial resources
questions.explanation: 'Only to' yapısı beklenmedik veya hayal kırıklığı yaratan sonucu ifade eder. Milyonlarca yatırım yapılmasına rağmen ürün başarısız olmuş.

questions.question_text: ---- the rise of social media platforms, traditional forms of journalism have had to adapt their strategies.
questions.explanation: 'In the wake of' (ardından, sonucunda) sosyal medyanın yükselişinin gazetecilikte değişime yol açtığını gösterir. Neden-sonuç ilişkisini ifade eder.

questions.question_text: Scientists predict that within the next few decades, ----.
questions.option_a: renewable energy sources will become more expensive than fossil fuels
questions.option_b: technological advancements will enable humans to explore deep space
questions.option_c: global temperatures will decrease significantly without intervention
questions.option_d: the world's population will decline to pre-industrial levels
questions.option_e: diseases that were eradicated will return in full force
questions.explanation: Bilim insanlarının önümüzdeki on yıllara dair olumlu bir tahmini teknolojik gelişmeler ve uzay keşfi ile ilgilidir. Diğer seçenekler mantıksız veya olumsuz.

questions.question_text: ---- extensive research on the effects of sleep deprivation, many people still underestimate its impact on health.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' (rağmen) araştırmaların varlığı ile insanların bilgisizliği arasındaki zıtlığı ifade eder.

questions.question_text: The archaeological site was carefully excavated ----.
questions.option_a: so that valuable artifacts would be destroyed in the process
questions.option_b: to preserve any historical evidence that might be uncovered
questions.option_c: although researchers had no interest in the findings
questions.option_d: because it was known to contain nothing of significance
questions.option_e: unless proper permits were completely ignored
questions.explanation: Arkeolojik alan dikkatli kazıldığında amaç tarihi kanıtları korumaktır. 'To preserve' (korumak için) bu amacı ifade eder.

questions.question_text: Economic experts recommend ---- during periods of high inflation.
questions.option_a: that consumers increase their spending on luxury items
questions.option_b: to invest heavily in unstable financial markets
questions.option_c: diversifying investment portfolios to minimize risk
questions.option_d: ignoring all financial advice from professionals
questions.option_e: that individuals take on maximum debt
questions.explanation: Yüksek enflasyon döneminde ekonomistler riski azaltmak için portföy çeşitlendirmesini önerir. Bu mantıklı ve yaygın bir tavsiyedir.

questions.question_text: ---- their limited resources, the research team produced groundbreaking results.
questions.explanation: 'Notwithstanding' (rağmen) sınırlı kaynaklar ile çığır açan sonuçlar arasındaki zıtlığı ifade eden formal bir terimdir.

questions.question_text: The new urban development plan ---- before its implementation next year.
questions.option_a: will have been approved by the city council
questions.explanation: Gelecekte bir zamandan önce tamamlanacak eylem için future perfect kullanılır: will have been approved. Plan önümüzdeki yıl uygulanmadan önce onaylanacak.

questions.question_text: Ocean acidification, caused by the absorption of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, poses a serious threat to marine ecosystems. ---- This process disrupts the ability of shellfish and corals to build their protective structures, potentially leading to widespread die-offs.
questions.option_a: The ocean's pH levels have remained stable for millions of years
questions.option_b: As seawater absorbs CO2, it becomes more acidic, lowering its pH
questions.option_c: Marine species have shown no sensitivity to chemical changes
questions.option_d: Acidification improves conditions for most marine organisms
questions.option_e: Carbon dioxide has no measurable effect on ocean chemistry
questions.explanation: Boşluk okyanus asitlenmesinin nasıl gerçekleştiğini açıklamalı. Sonraki cümlede kabukluların etkilenmesinden bahsediliyor, bu da pH düşüşü ile bağlantılı.

questions.question_text: The concept of emotional intelligence has gained significant attention in recent years. ---- Research suggests that individuals with high emotional intelligence tend to have better relationships and are more successful in their careers.
questions.option_a: Critics argue that IQ is the only valid measure of human intelligence
questions.option_b: It refers to the ability to recognize, understand, and manage one's own emotions and those of others
questions.option_c: Emotional responses have no impact on decision-making processes
questions.option_d: Most people completely lack any form of emotional awareness
questions.option_e: Traditional intelligence tests adequately measure all human capabilities
questions.explanation: Boşluk duygusal zekanın tanımını vermeli. Sonraki cümle yüksek duygusal zekaya sahip bireylerin başarılarından bahsediyor.

questions.question_text: Quantum computing represents a paradigm shift in computational power. Unlike classical computers that use bits, quantum computers utilize quantum bits or qubits. ---- This exponential increase in processing capability could revolutionize fields such as cryptography and drug discovery.
questions.option_a: Qubits can only exist in a single state at any given time
questions.option_b: Classical computing remains superior for all applications
questions.option_c: These qubits can exist in multiple states simultaneously, enabling parallel processing
questions.option_d: Quantum mechanics has no practical applications in computing
questions.option_e: The technology offers no advantages over current systems
questions.explanation: Boşluk qubit'lerin özelliğini ve neden güçlü olduklarını açıklamalı. Sonraki cümledeki 'exponential increase' ifadesi paralel işleme yeteneği ile bağlantılı.

questions.question_text: Urban green spaces provide numerous benefits to city dwellers. ---- Furthermore, they contribute to biodiversity by providing habitats for various species.
questions.option_a: Cities should eliminate all parks to maximize building space
questions.option_b: Green spaces have no measurable impact on residents' lives
questions.option_c: They offer recreational opportunities, improve air quality, and reduce urban heat
questions.option_d: Urban development and nature cannot coexist in any form
questions.option_e: Parks contribute to increased pollution in metropolitan areas
questions.explanation: Boşluk yeşil alanların faydalarını saymalı. 'Furthermore' kelimesi ek bir fayda (biyoçeşitlilik) ekleneceğini gösterir.

questions.question_text: The placebo effect demonstrates the powerful connection between mind and body. ---- Scientists continue to investigate the neurological mechanisms underlying this intriguing phenomenon.
questions.option_a: Medical treatments always work through purely physical mechanisms
questions.option_b: When patients believe they are receiving treatment, their symptoms may improve even if the treatment is inactive
questions.option_c: The mind has absolutely no influence on physical health outcomes
questions.option_d: Placebo effects only occur in cases of misdiagnosis
questions.option_e: Patients never respond to treatments without active ingredients
questions.explanation: Boşluk plasebo etkisinin ne olduğunu açıklamalı. Sonraki cümlede bilim insanlarının bu fenomeni araştırdığından bahsediliyor.

questions.question_text: Financial literacy is increasingly recognized as an essential life skill. ---- Without such knowledge, individuals may struggle with debt, fail to save adequately, or fall victim to financial fraud.
questions.option_a: Understanding basic concepts like budgeting, saving, and investing enables people to make informed decisions
questions.option_b: Most people naturally possess all necessary financial knowledge
questions.option_c: Money management requires no specific skills or education
questions.option_d: Financial decisions should always be made without any planning
questions.option_e: Learning about finances provides no practical advantages
questions.explanation: Boşluk finansal okuryazarlığın neleri içerdiğini açıklamalı. Sonraki cümledeki 'without such knowledge' ifadesi önceki cümlede bahsedilen bilgiyi kastediyor.

questions.question_text: Neuroplasticity refers to the brain's ability to reorganize itself by forming new neural connections. ---- This discovery has profound implications for rehabilitation after brain injury and for understanding how learning occurs.
questions.option_a: The brain's structure remains completely fixed after early childhood
questions.option_b: This capacity allows the brain to adapt to new situations, learn from experiences, and recover from damage
questions.option_c: Neural pathways cannot be modified under any circumstances
questions.option_d: Brain cells are incapable of forming new connections
questions.option_e: Learning has no effect on brain structure or function
questions.explanation: Boşluk nöroplastisitenin önemini ve etkilerini açıklamalı. Sonraki cümle rehabilitasyon ve öğrenme ile ilgili sonuçlardan bahsediyor.

questions.question_text: The gig economy has transformed traditional employment patterns. While it offers flexibility and autonomy, ----. Policymakers now face the challenge of ensuring adequate protections for workers in this evolving landscape.
questions.option_a: it provides guaranteed benefits and job security for all workers
questions.option_b: workers in traditional employment have been completely abandoned
questions.option_c: it also raises concerns about job security, benefits, and worker rights
questions.option_d: the gig economy has eliminated all forms of exploitation
questions.option_e: no challenges or disadvantages exist in this model
questions.explanation: Boşluk gig ekonomisinin olumsuz yönlerini belirtmeli çünkü 'while' bir zıtlık gösterir. Sonraki cümle işçi korumaları ile ilgili zorluktan bahsediyor.

questions.question_text: Antibiotic resistance has become one of the most pressing global health challenges. ----. Health organizations worldwide are working to promote responsible antibiotic use and develop alternative treatments.
questions.option_a: Bacteria have no ability to adapt to antibiotics over time
questions.option_b: The overuse and misuse of antibiotics have accelerated the evolution of resistant bacterial strains
questions.option_c: All infections can still be easily treated with existing antibiotics
questions.option_d: Antibiotic effectiveness has increased dramatically in recent years
questions.option_e: Bacterial infections pose less threat now than ever before
questions.explanation: Boşluk antibiyotik direncinin nedenini açıklamalı. Sonraki cümle sorumlu antibiyotik kullanımından bahsediyor, bu da aşırı kullanımdan kaynaklanan sorun olduğunu gösterir.

questions.question_text: The concept of a circular economy challenges the traditional linear model of production and consumption. ---- By doing so, it aims to minimize waste, extend product lifecycles, and reduce environmental impact.
questions.option_a: It promotes the continuous disposal of products after single use
questions.option_b: Resources should be extracted and discarded as quickly as possible
questions.option_c: Instead of the 'take-make-dispose' approach, it emphasizes reusing, repairing, and recycling materials
questions.option_d: Environmental concerns should be ignored in economic planning
questions.option_e: The linear economy is more sustainable than any alternative
questions.explanation: Boşluk dairesel ekonominin ne olduğunu ve geleneksel modelden farkını açıklamalı. Sonraki cümledeki 'by doing so' önceki cümlede bahsedilen yaklaşımı kastediyor.

(III) Wind turbines harness kinetic energy from moving air to generate power. (IV) The price of smartphones has decreased significantly over the past decade. questions.passage:
The human microbiome, consisting of trillions of microorganisms living in and on our bodies, has emerged as a critical factor in health and disease. These microscopic inhabitants, primarily bacteria, play essential roles in digestion, immune system development, and even mental health. Recent research has revealed that the composition of our microbiome can influence everything from our susceptibility to infections to our mood and behavior.

The gut microbiome, in particular, has garnered significant scientific attention. Scientists have discovered that the bacteria in our digestive system produce neurotransmitters and other compounds that communicate with the brain through what is called the gut-brain axis. This bidirectional communication pathway helps explain why gut health can affect mental well-being and why stress can cause digestive problems.

Factors such as diet, antibiotic use, and lifestyle significantly impact the diversity and balance of our microbiome. A diet rich in fiber and fermented foods promotes beneficial bacteria, while excessive sugar and processed foods can lead to an unhealthy microbial composition. Understanding and maintaining a healthy microbiome may be key to preventing various chronic diseases and promoting overall wellness.
questions.question_text: According to the passage, the gut-brain axis ----.
questions.option_a: is a one-way communication system from the brain to the gut
questions.option_b: explains the relationship between digestive health and mental state
questions.option_c: has no impact on neurotransmitter production
questions.option_d: only becomes active during periods of high stress
questions.option_e: prevents all communication between gut bacteria and the brain
questions.explanation: İkinci paragrafta gut-brain axis'in iki yönlü iletişim yolu olduğu ve bağırsak sağlığının zihinsel durum üzerindeki etkisini açıkladığı belirtiliyor.

questions.passage:
The phenomenon of linguistic relativity, also known as the Sapir-Whorf hypothesis, suggests that the language we speak influences how we think and perceive the world. This controversial idea has sparked decades of debate among linguists, psychologists, and anthropologists. While the strong version of this hypothesis—that language determines thought—has been largely discredited, a weaker version suggesting that language influences thought patterns continues to find empirical support.

Research has shown that speakers of different languages do indeed perceive and categorize certain aspects of reality differently. For instance, languages that have multiple words for different types of snow enable speakers to make finer distinctions in snow-related contexts. Similarly, languages that grammatically mark the gender of nouns may influence how speakers conceptualize those objects.

However, critics argue that these differences are superficial and that all humans share fundamental cognitive capacities that transcend linguistic boundaries. They contend that while language may shape the ease or efficiency with which we think about certain concepts, it does not fundamentally limit our cognitive abilities. The debate continues to evolve as new experimental methodologies provide fresh insights into this complex relationship.
questions.question_text: What is the main idea of this passage?
questions.option_a: Language completely determines how humans think about reality
questions.option_b: All languages are essentially identical in how they represent the world
questions.option_c: The relationship between language and thought remains a subject of ongoing scientific debate
questions.option_d: Linguistic relativity has been conclusively proven by modern research
questions.option_e: Cognitive abilities are entirely independent of language
questions.explanation: Paragraf boyunca dilsel göreliliğin tartışmalı doğası vurgulanıyor ve farklı görüşler sunuluyor. Son cümle tartışmanın devam ettiğini belirtiyor.

questions.passage:
Urban heat islands are metropolitan areas that experience significantly higher temperatures than their rural surroundings, primarily due to human activities and infrastructure. This phenomenon occurs because concrete, asphalt, and buildings absorb and retain heat more effectively than natural landscapes. During the day, these surfaces absorb solar radiation, and at night, they release the stored heat, keeping urban areas warmer than the countryside.

The consequences of urban heat islands extend beyond mere discomfort. Elevated temperatures increase energy consumption for cooling, worsen air quality by accelerating the formation of ground-level ozone, and can pose serious health risks, particularly for vulnerable populations such as the elderly and those with pre-existing conditions. Heat-related illnesses and deaths tend to spike during extreme heat events in urban centers.

Fortunately, cities can implement various strategies to mitigate this effect. Increasing vegetation through urban forests and green roofs helps cool the air through evapotranspiration. Using reflective or light-colored materials for roofs and pavements reduces heat absorption. Additionally, strategic urban planning that incorporates parks, water features, and shaded areas can significantly lower local temperatures and improve residents' quality of life.
questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a consequence of urban heat islands?
questions.option_a: Increased energy costs for cooling buildings

questions.passage:
Urban heat islands are metropolitan areas that experience significantly higher temperatures than their rural surroundings, primarily due to human activities and infrastructure. This phenomenon occurs because concrete, asphalt, and buildings absorb and retain heat more effectively than natural landscapes. During the day, these surfaces absorb solar radiation, and at night, they release the stored heat, keeping urban areas warmer than the countryside.

The consequences of urban heat islands extend beyond mere discomfort. Elevated temperatures increase energy consumption for cooling, worsen air quality by accelerating the formation of ground-level ozone, and can pose serious health risks, particularly for vulnerable populations such as the elderly and those with pre-existing conditions. Heat-related illnesses and deaths tend to spike during extreme heat events in urban centers.

Fortunately, cities can implement various strategies to mitigate this effect. Increasing vegetation through urban forests and green roofs helps cool the air through evapotranspiration. Using reflective or light-colored materials for roofs and pavements reduces heat absorption. Additionally, strategic urban planning that incorporates parks, water features, and shaded areas can significantly lower local temperatures and improve residents' quality of life.

questions.explanation: 'Mitigate' hafifletmek, azaltmak anlamına gelir. Bağlamda kentlerin ısı adası etkisini azaltmak için stratejiler uygulayabileceği belirtiliyor.

questions.passage:
The practice of mindfulness meditation has gained widespread popularity in Western societies, yet its roots trace back thousands of years to Eastern philosophical and religious traditions. Mindfulness involves paying attention to present-moment experiences with openness, curiosity, and acceptance, rather than judgment. This seemingly simple practice has been shown to produce measurable changes in brain structure and function.

Neuroscientific research has demonstrated that regular mindfulness practice can alter the structure of brain regions associated with attention, emotion regulation, and self-awareness. Studies using brain imaging techniques have found increased gray matter density in areas such as the hippocampus, which plays a crucial role in learning and memory, and decreased density in the amygdala, the brain's fear center. These structural changes correlate with practitioners' reports of reduced stress and improved emotional well-being.

However, researchers caution against viewing mindfulness as a panacea for all psychological and physical ailments. While evidence supports its efficacy for conditions such as anxiety, depression, and chronic pain, mindfulness may not be suitable for everyone. Some individuals with certain psychiatric conditions may experience adverse effects. As with any intervention, individual differences and proper guidance from trained practitioners are essential for safe and effective practice.
questions.question_text: What does the passage imply about mindfulness meditation?
questions.option_a: It is a recently developed Western psychological technique
questions.option_b: It can cure all physical and mental health problems
questions.option_c: It may not be appropriate for all individuals
questions.option_d: It has no measurable effects on brain structure
questions.option_e: It should replace all other forms of medical treatment
questions.explanation: Üçüncü paragrafta mindfulness'ın herkes için uygun olmayabileceği ve bazı psikiyatrik durumları olan kişilerin olumsuz etkiler yaşayabileceği belirtiliyor.

questions.passage:
Gene editing technologies, particularly CRISPR-Cas9, have revolutionized the field of genetics by providing unprecedented precision in modifying DNA sequences. This powerful tool allows scientists to add, remove, or alter genetic material at specific locations in the genome with relative ease and accuracy. The potential applications range from treating genetic disorders to enhancing crop resilience and eradicating disease-carrying mosquitoes.

In medicine, gene editing holds promise for treating conditions previously considered incurable. Researchers are exploring its use for sickle cell disease, certain cancers, and inherited blindness. Early clinical trials have shown encouraging results, with some patients experiencing significant improvements in their conditions. However, the technology is still in its infancy, and many challenges remain, including delivery methods, off-target effects, and immune responses.

The ethical implications of gene editing, especially concerning human embryos, have sparked intense debate. While somatic cell editing (modifying non-reproductive cells) is generally viewed as acceptable for treating diseases, germline editing (changes that can be inherited) raises profound questions about designer babies, eugenics, and social equity. Many countries have implemented regulations or moratoriums on germline editing, reflecting the need for careful consideration of the technology's societal impact before widespread implementation.
questions.question_text: The author's tone in discussing gene editing can best be described as ----.
questions.option_c: balanced, acknowledging both promise and concerns
questions.explanation: Yazar hem gen düzenlemenin potansiyel faydalarını hem de tıbbi zorlukları ve etik endişeleri dengeli bir şekilde sunuyor. Tarafsız ve objektif bir ton kullanılıyor.

questions.passage:
The decline of coral reefs represents one of the most visible manifestations of climate change and ocean degradation. These underwater ecosystems, often called the 'rainforests of the sea,' support an estimated 25% of all marine species despite covering less than 1% of the ocean floor. However, rising ocean temperatures, acidification, pollution, and overfishing have pushed many reefs to the brink of collapse.

Coral bleaching, the process by which corals expel the symbiotic algae that provide them with food and color, has become increasingly frequent and severe. When water temperatures rise even slightly above normal levels, corals undergo stress and expel these crucial partners. While corals can recover if conditions improve quickly, prolonged or repeated bleaching events often prove fatal. The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral system, has experienced multiple mass bleaching events in recent years, with some areas showing minimal signs of recovery.

Conservation efforts are underway globally, including the establishment of marine protected areas, restoration projects using coral nurseries, and research into heat-resistant coral strains. However, scientists emphasize that these measures, while important, cannot succeed without addressing the root cause: climate change. Reducing greenhouse gas emissions and limiting global temperature rise remain the most critical actions for ensuring the survival of coral reefs for future generations.

questions.option_a: To explain the biological structure of coral polyps
questions.option_b: To describe the threats facing coral reefs and conservation efforts
questions.option_c: To argue that coral reefs are unimportant to marine ecosystems
questions.option_d: To prove that coral bleaching is a natural and harmless process
questions.option_e: To criticize all current coral reef conservation methods

questions.passage:
Artificial neural networks, inspired by the structure and function of biological brains, form the foundation of modern machine learning and artificial intelligence systems. These computational models consist of interconnected nodes or 'neurons' organized in layers. Information flows through the network, with each connection assigned a weight that determines the strength of its influence. Through a process called training, the network adjusts these weights to improve its performance on specific tasks.

Deep learning, a subset of machine learning utilizing neural networks with many layers, has achieved remarkable success in recent years. Applications range from image recognition and natural language processing to autonomous vehicles and medical diagnosis. The technology can now perform tasks that were once thought to require human-level intelligence, such as playing complex strategy games and generating creative content.

Despite these achievements, artificial neural networks have significant limitations. They typically require enormous amounts of data and computational resources for training. More importantly, they function as 'black boxes'—their decision-making processes are often opaque and difficult to interpret, raising concerns about accountability and bias. Researchers are actively working on making these systems more transparent, efficient, and capable of learning from smaller datasets, similar to how humans learn.

questions.option_a: they cannot perform any tasks requiring intelligence
questions.option_b: their decision-making processes are difficult to understand
questions.option_c: they are inspired by biological brain structure
questions.option_d: they have achieved no significant accomplishments
questions.option_e: they learn too quickly from small amounts of data

questions.passage:
The concept of universal basic income (UBI)—providing all citizens with a regular, unconditional cash payment—has gained renewed attention as automation and artificial intelligence threaten to displace workers across various sectors. Proponents argue that UBI could serve as a safety net in an increasingly precarious job market, reduce poverty, and simplify the welfare system by replacing numerous targeted programs with a single payment.

Supporters point to pilot programs in countries like Finland and Kenya that have shown promising results, including improved mental health, increased entrepreneurship, and better educational outcomes. They contend that UBI would give people the freedom to pursue education, care for family members, or engage in creative endeavors without the constant pressure of financial survival. Additionally, eliminating the bureaucracy associated with means-tested benefits could reduce administrative costs.

Critics, however, raise several concerns. The primary objection relates to cost: implementing UBI at a meaningful level would require substantial tax increases or reallocation of existing government spending. Some worry that unconditional payments might reduce work incentives, though pilot studies have found minimal effects on employment. Others argue that targeted assistance programs better address specific needs and that UBI might benefit those who need help least. The debate reflects broader questions about social welfare, work ethics, and economic justice in the 21st century.

questions.option_c: Automation will definitely lead to mass unemployment
questions.option_d: All welfare programs should be immediately replaced with UBI
questions.option_e: Critics of UBI have no valid arguments against its implementation

questions.question_text: The recent surge in electric vehicle sales, coupled with advancements in battery technology and expanded charging infrastructure, ----.

questions.question_text: Although the new policy was designed with good intentions, its implementation has faced numerous obstacles, including insufficient funding and resistance from stakeholders, ----.
questions.option_a: proving that the policy was perfectly conceived and flawless
questions.option_b: demonstrating that good intentions always lead to success
questions.option_c: highlighting the gap between policy design and practical execution
questions.option_d: showing that all stakeholders fully support the initiative
questions.option_e: indicating that funding is always unlimited for new policies
questions.explanation: Cümlede iyi niyetli bir politikanın uygulama aşamasında karşılaştığı zorluklar anlatılıyor. Bu, politika tasarımı ile pratikte uygulama arasındaki farkı vurguluyor.

questions.question_text: The athlete's rigorous training regimen, combined with her natural talent and unwavering determination, ---- her to achieve unprecedented success.
questions.explanation: Özne 'regimen' tekil olduğu için tekil fiil kullanılmalı. 'Combined with' sonrası özneyi değiştirmez. Present perfect tense geçmişte başlayan ve şimdi sonuçları görülen durumu ifade eder.

questions.question_text: ---- the complexity of the issue, policymakers have struggled to develop effective solutions that satisfy all stakeholders.
questions.explanation: 'Given' (göz önüne alındığında) isim grubundan önce kullanılır ve neden-sonuç ilişkisini ifade eder. Karmaşıklık nedeniyle çözüm geliştirmekte zorlanılmış.

questions.question_text: The research team's findings were so ---- that they decided to replicate the experiment to ensure accuracy.
questions.explanation: 'Anomalous' (anormal, beklenmedik) bulgular deneyin tekrarlanması gerekliliğini açıklar. Olağandışı sonuçlar doğruluğun teyit edilmesini gerektirir.

questions.question_text: The company's decision to ---- its operations to developing markets proved to be highly profitable.
questions.explanation: 'Expand' (genişletmek) gelişmekte olan pazarlara operasyonları götürme ve 'highly profitable' (oldukça karlı) sonuçla uyumludur.

questions.question_text: It is essential that every participant ---- the safety guidelines before engaging in the activity.
questions.explanation: 'It is essential/important/necessary that' yapısından sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. Bu nedenle 'understand' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: The journalist's investigation ---- widespread corruption within the organization, leading to several high-profile resignations.
questions.explanation: 'Uncover' (ortaya çıkarmak) gazetecinin yolsuzluk bulduğunu ve bunun istifa ile sonuçlandığını ifade eder. Araştırma ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur.

questions.question_text: The scientists are optimistic that they ---- a breakthrough in renewable energy technology within the next decade.
questions.explanation: 'Within the next decade' gelecek zaman ifadesidir ve future simple tense (will achieve) kullanılmalıdır.

questions.question_text: The professor's lecture was so ---- that many students struggled to understand the key concepts.
questions.explanation: 'Convoluted' (karmaşık, dolambaçlı) öğrencilerin anlamakta zorlanması ile uyumlu. Diğer seçenekler net ve anlaşılır anlamlar taşır.

questions.question_text: Had the government implemented the reforms earlier, the economic crisis ---- averted.
questions.explanation: Inversion ile kurulan third conditional: Had + subject + past participle, modal + have + past participle. Geçmişte gerçekleşmeyen durum ve olası sonucu ifade eder.

questions.question_text: The diplomat's ---- approach to negotiations helped resolve the conflict peacefully.
questions.explanation: 'Tactful' (nazik, diplomatik) barışçıl çözüm ile uyumludur. Diğer seçenekler agresif veya olumsuz yaklaşımları ifade eder.

questions.question_text: The art exhibition, ---- featured works from emerging artists, attracted thousands of visitors.
questions.explanation: 'Which' virgülden sonra non-defining relative clause oluşturur. Sergi hakkında ek bilgi verir. 'That' virgülle kullanılmaz.

questions.question_text: The new evidence ---- the defendant's claim of innocence, casting doubt on the prosecution's case.
questions.explanation: 'Corroborate' (doğrulamak, desteklemek) masumiyet iddiasını destekler ve savcılığın davasını sorgulatır. Kanıt ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur.

questions.question_text: Little ---- that their decision would have such far-reaching consequences.
questions.explanation: 'Little' olumsuz anlam taşır ve cümle başında inversion gerektirir: little + auxiliary + subject + main verb. Bu nedenle 'did they realize' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: The author's narrative was ---- with vivid descriptions that brought the historical period to life.
questions.explanation: 'Replete with' (ile dolu) canlı tasvirler ile kullanılır ve yazarın zengin anlatımını ifade eder. Diğer seçenekler eksiklik belirtir.

questions.question_text: The committee members, all of ---- are experts in their fields, will evaluate the proposals next week.
questions.explanation: 'All of whom' yapısı insanlara atıfta bulunurken kullanılır. 'Whom' preposition (of) sonrası için doğru object form'dur. 'Who' subject form olduğu için yanlış.
